subject: International Monetary Fund
body:
International Monetary Fund
Office of the Registrar
IMF Administrative Tribunal
700 19th Street, NW, Suite HQ1-3-544
Washington, DC 20431, USA
RE: PAYMENT OF YOUR INHERITANCE /COMPENSATION FUND
Attn: Beneficiary,
It has come to my knowledge that most fund beneficiaries of
contract/inheritance payment like you are being asked to pay certain
irrelevant charges by some bank officials , custom department ,
security and other government agencies, thereby making it very
difficult for beneficiaries to meet such obligations which is
contrary to Section '37' Subsection 'C' of the Article XII of Banks
and other financial decree of 1995 as amended in 1998.
In view of this, the United Nations (UN) in collaboration with
International monetary fund ( IMF ) and World bank has directed the
World bank to shift its base to Nigeria to
scrutinize and oversee an immediate release of such payments that has
met the requirements for effectiveness without any further delay. Any
a beneficiary certified 'OK' will receive his / her fund within five (5)
working days from the date of the final authentication of his / her
contractual date. It is also interesting to inform you that
in order to carry out deductions on their bills as regards Cost of
Transfers (COT), Security Deposit (SD),insurance , custom , shipping
and other taxable charges, beneficiaries will be required to obtain
a Waiver Affidavit from the federal high court of appeal in Abuja,
Nigeria,so as
to empower this board to carry out such deduction from the total
contract/inheritance sum before final remittance.
Furthermore, certification and unconditional payment release orders
has been invested on this board and it involves payment from our
statutory foreign reserves of international capital markets (ICM) loans
from (IMF) and the World Bank respectively.
Once you obtain a waiver affidavit there will be no further upfront
payment and this will bring an end to your nightmare and long delay
in receiving your payment.
You are therefore advised to contact Olukayode Ariwoola Chief
Judge ,Supreme Court of Nigeria , so he can assist you to obtain a waiver affidavit from the Supreme
Court of Nigeria.
Find below his contact information.
Name of contact person:Olukayode Ariwoola
Email:olukayodeariwoola@diplomats.com
Phone:+234-9017592398
He will not charge you any legal fee but the only fee you have to pay
is $125 to obtain the waiver affidavit from the supreme court of Nigeria .
Once you obtain the waiver affidavit the paying bank will be legally
bound to deduct all other fees from the principal sum and pay you the balance without any further upfront fees.
But if you fail to obtain the waiver affidavit you will be charged alot of exorbitant fees.
So I advise that you obtain the waiver affidavit for only $125 so that all other fees will be deducted.
We are very sorry for all the inconvenience you have suffered trying to receive your fund.
Yours Faithfully,
Kristalina Georgieva
IMF DIRECTOR

subject: Re:   International Monetary Fund
body:
Hello,

Thank you for reaching out and providing such detailed information. It's quite a lot to take in, but I'm trying my best to understand it all.

If I understand correctly, the United Nations, IMF, and World Bank are working together to ensure that payments are released without delay. That sounds like a great initiative!

You mentioned something about obtaining a Waiver Affidavit from the federal high court of appeal in Abuja. Could you please explain more about this? What exactly is a Waiver Affidavit and why is it necessary?

Also, you mentioned contacting Olukayode Ariwoola, the Chief Judge Court of Nigeria. How would I go about doing this? Is there an email or phone number I could use?

I appreciate your patience with me as I try to understand all of this.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Erica

subject: International Monetary Fund
body:
Supreme Court of Nigeria 
Three-Arms Zone. P.M.B. 308. 
Garki. Abuja. 
Phone:+234-9017592398 
 
Attn.Erica, 
 
I acknowledge the receipt of your email  regarding the waiver affidavit 
as directed by   by Kristalina Georgieva,IMF DIRECTOR . 
Once you obtain a waiver affidavit there will be no further upfront 
payment and this will bring an end to your nightmare and long delay 
in receiving your payment.This is because the Waiver Affidavit will empower the paying bank to deduct any other fee from the principal sum of $10.5 million. 
The cst of obtaining the Waiver Affidavit is $125 only. 
You can send the $125 by  western Union , World remit , money gram or Ria money transfer 
in the name of the court registrar below. 
RECEIVER'S NAME : ISAAC UCHE AMADI 
FIRST NAME: ISAAC 
MIDDLE NAME : UCHE 
SURNAME : AMADI 
RECEIVER'S ADDRESS : LAGOS, NIGERIA 
Once you send the $125 I will obtain the waiver affidavit in your name and then 
you will be able to receive your contract/Inheritance funds of USD$10.5 Million  without any 
other fees or hurdle. 
I have  attached  copy of my ID card  to this email. 
Yours Sincerely, 
Olukayode Ariwoola 
Chief Judge

subject: Re: International Monetary Fund
body:
Hello Olukayode Ariwoola,

Thank you for your email and the detailed information. It's interesting to learn about the process of obtaining a waiver affidavit. I'm curious, could you explain more about what this document is? And how does it empower the paying bank to deduct any other fee from the principal sum?

Also, I've never used services like Western Union or Money Gram before. Could you guide me through how these work? 

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Erica

subject: International Monetary Fund
body:
Supreme Court of Nigeria 
Three-Arms Zone. P.M.B. 308. 
Garki. Abuja. 
Phone:+234-9017592398 
 
Attn.Erica, 
 
The Waiver Affidavit is obtained from the Supreme court of Nigeria that is why it can give the paying bank the legal backing to deduct fees. 
What country are you from so I can direct you how to send the fee? 
Apart from western union or money gram you can send by World remit or sendwave. 
Yours Sincerely, 
Olukayode Ariwoola 
Chief Judge

subject: International Monetary Fund
body:
Supreme Court of Nigeria 
Three-Arms Zone. P.M.B. 308. 
Garki. Abuja. 
Phone:+234-9017592398 
 
Attn.Erica, 
I have not heard from you about the $125 Waiver Affidavit fee. 
Yours Sincerely, 
Olukayode Ariwoola 
Chief Judge

subject: Re: International Monetary Fund
body:
Hello Olukayode Ariwoola,

Thank you for your message. It's interesting to learn about the Waiver Affidavit from the Supreme Court of Nigeria. I'm curious, how does this legal backing work exactly? 

As for my country, I'd rather not disclose that information at this time. However, I am interested in learning more about these payment methods you mentioned - Western Union, Money Gram, World Remit and Sendwave. Could you please explain how each of them works?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Erica

subject: Re: International Monetary Fund
body:
Hello Olukayode Ariwoola,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I must admit, I'm not entirely sure what the Waiver Affidavit fee is about. Could you please provide more details? What exactly does this fee cover and why is it necessary?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Erica
